abstract: Google, which makes the vast majority of its money selling search ads, said Wednesday that its venture capital arm has invested in Trada, a start-up that makes it easier for small businesses to buy those ads by crowdsourcing the work.
snippet: Google, which makes the vast majority of its money selling search ads, said Wednesday that its venture capital arm has invested in Trada, a start-up that makes it easier for small businesses to buy those ads by crowdsourcing the work.
lead_paragraph: From Claire Cain Miller at Bits:

headline.main: Google Ventures Finances a Search Marketing Start-Up

abstract: Facebook, the social network created in the dormitories of Harvard six years ago, said on Wednesday that it now had 500 million members.
snippet: Facebook, the social network created in the dormitories of Harvard six years ago, said on Wednesday that it now had 500 million members.
lead_paragraph: Facebook, the social network created in the dormitories of Harvard six years ago, said on Wednesday that it now had 500 million members, The New York Times’s Jenna Wortham reported.
